unnormalised: CBSE Class 10 results were declared today at 12 PM. The overall pass percentage stood at 93.12%, a slight dip compared to last year's 93.31%. Girls outperformed boys with a pass percentage of 94.25% compared to 92.72% for boys.
normalised: C-B-S-E Class ten results were declared today at twelve P-M. The overall pass percentage stood at ninety three point one two percent, a slight dip compared to last year's ninety three point three one percent. Girls outperformed boys with a pass percentage of ninety four point two five percent compared to ninety two point seven two percent for boys.

unnormalised: Ramesh Kumar of Delhi Public School, RK Puram secured 498/500 marks, topping the charts. Several other students scored above 95% across various schools in India, reflecting a high standard of academic performance. Students can check their results on the official CBSE website using their roll no. and date of birth.
normalised: Ramesh Kumar of Delhi Public School, R-K Puram secured four hundred and ninety eight divided by five hundred marks, topping the charts. Several other students scored above ninety five percent across various schools in India, reflecting a high standard of academic performance. Students can check their results on the official C-B-S-E website using their roll no. and date of birth.

unnormalised: The grading system remains the same, with A1 being the highest grade and E being the failing grade. The CBSE has also announced that re-evaluation requests can be submitted online from 25/05/2024 to 01/06/2024. Students can also apply for verification of marks and obtain a photocopy of their answer sheets.
normalised: The grading system remains the same, with A one being the highest grade and E being the failing grade. The C-B-S-E has also announced that re-evaluation requests can be submitted online from twenty fifth May two thousand and twenty four to first June two thousand and twenty four. Students can also apply for verification of marks and obtain a photocopy of their answer sheets.

unnormalised: Parents are advised to counsel their children irrespective of the marks obtained. The CBSE aims to provide a holistic learning environment, and marks are just one aspect of a student's overall development. Remember that many successful individuals didn't always score the highest marks in school but excelled in their chosen fields.
normalised: Parents are advised to counsel their children irrespective of the marks obtained. The C-B-S-E aims to provide a holistic learning environment, and marks are just one aspect of a student's overall development. Remember that many successful individuals didn't always score the highest marks in school but excelled in their chosen fields.

unnormalised: The board plans to conduct the Class 10 compartment exams in July. Students who did not pass one or two subjects can appear for the compartment exams to save a year. Details regarding the compartment exam schedule and registration process will be available on the CBSE website by 15/06/2024.
normalised: The board plans to conduct the Class ten compartment exams in July. Students who did not pass one or two subjects can appear for the compartment exams to save a year. Details regarding the compartment exam schedule and registration process will be available on the C-B-S-E website by fifteenth June two thousand and twenty four.
